greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest k such that 3^k has exactly n 0's in its decimal representation.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2000
maple: for k from 1 while count <= N do
if m <= N and A[m] < 0 then A[m]:= k; count:= count+1 fi
mathematica: a = {}; Do[k = 1; While[ Count[ IntegerDigits[3^k], 0] != n, k++ ]; a = Append[a, k], {n, 0, 50} ]; a
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 10 2001
